page.title: 14EAST HORRINGTON
page.content: East Horrington lies on an ancient beach onthe southern flank of The Mendips. Many of the houses in this small hamlet have extensive views over the Somerset levels. The two most distinguished buildings are the church which is no longer in use and Chilcote Manor which was a prebendal manor i.e. belonging to the Cathedral. Recently, several of the former agricultural buildings have been renovated to provide attractive homes for newcomers to the village. Development of the village has extended down the road to Wells where some houses have been built for people employed at the Mendip Hospital.
